ETYMOLOGY: From Old French 'discrecion' (12th C.), from Latin 'discretio' ('separation, distinction'), from 'discernere' ('to separate, discern').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The quality of behaving or speaking in such a way as to avoid causing offense or revealing private information.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在言行举止上谨慎小心，以避免冒犯他人或泄露私人信息的品质。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I trust your discretion in handling this sensitive matter.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我信任你处理这件敏感事情的谨慎态度。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The freedom or authority to make judgments and to act as one sees fit; the power of independent decision.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 根据自己的判断和意愿行事的自由或权力；自行决断的权力。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The principal has the discretion to allow students to leave early.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 校长有权自行决定是否允许学生提前离校。

REGISTER: Formal to semi-formal, applicable in various contexts from personal conduct to legal or administrative decisions.
